   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(nofrag_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: %% This suite alters the return values of functions which breaks certain
   26: %% assumptions made by the compiler, so we have to turn off module-level type
   27: %% optimization to be safe.
   28: -compile(no_module_opt).
   29: 
   30: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   31:          error_handler/1,error_handler_apply/1,
   32:          error_handler_fixed_apply/1,error_handler_fun/1,
   33:          debug_breakpoint/1]).
   34: 
   35: %% Exported functions for an error_handler module.
   36: -export([undefined_function/3,undefined_lambda/3,breakpoint/3]).
   37: 
   38: suite() ->
   39:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   40:      {timetrap, {minutes, 3}}].
   41: 
   42: all() -> 
   43:     [error_handler, error_handler_apply,
   44:      error_handler_fixed_apply, error_handler_fun,
   45:      debug_breakpoint].
   46: 
   47: error_handler(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   48:     process_flag(error_handler, ?MODULE),
   49:     %% The term_to_binary/1 - binary_to_term/1 roundtrip is a good way
   50:     %% to traverse the entire term.
   51:     Term = collect(1024),
   52:     Term = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)),
   53:     1024 = length(Term),
   54:     [[a,b,c,d,[e,f,g]]] = lists:usort(Term),
   55:     ok.
   56: 
   57: collect(0) ->
   58:     [];
   59: collect(N) ->
   60:     %% The next line calls the error handle function, which is
   61:     %% ?MODULE:undefined_function/3 (it simply returns the list
   62:     %% of args, i.e. [a,b,c,d,[e,f,g]]).
   63:     C = fooblurf:x(a, b, c, d, [e,f,id(g)]),
   64: 
   65:     %% The variable C will be saved onto the stack frame; if C
   66:     %% points into a heap fragment the garbage collector will reach
   67:     %% it and the emulator will crash sooner or later (sooner if
   68:     %% the emulator is debug-compiled).
   69:     Res = collect(N-1),
   70:     [C|Res].
   71: 
   72: collect_apply(0, _) ->
   73:     [];
   74: collect_apply(N, Mod) ->
   75:     %% The next line calls the error handle function, which is
   76:     %% ?MODULE:undefined_function/3 (it simply returns the list
   77:     %% of args).
   78: 
   79:     C = apply(Mod, xyz, id([{a,id(42)},b,c,d,[e,f,id(g)]])),
   80: 
   81:     %% The variable C will be saved onto the stack frame; if C
   82:     %% points into a heap fragment the garbage collector will reach
   83:     %% it and the emulator will crash sooner or later (sooner if
   84:     %% the emulator is debug-compiled).
   85:     Res = collect_apply(N-1, Mod),
   86:     [C|Res].
   87: 
   88: error_handler_apply(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   89:     process_flag(error_handler, ?MODULE),
   90: 
   91:     %% The term_to_binary/1 - binary_to_term/1 roundtrip is a good way
   92:     %% to traverse the entire term.
   93:     Term = collect_apply(1024, fooblurfbar),
   94:     Term = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)),
   95:     1024 = length(Term),
   96:     [[{a,42},b,c,d,[e,f,g]]] = lists:usort(Term),
   97:     ok.
   98: 
   99: error_handler_fixed_apply(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  100:     process_flag(error_handler, ?MODULE),
  101: 
  102:     %% The term_to_binary/1 - binary_to_term/1 roundtrip is a good way
  103:     %% to traverse the entire term.
  104:     Term = collect_fixed_apply(1024, fooblurfbar),
  105:     Term = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)),
  106:     1024 = length(Term),
  107:     [[{a,2},b,c,d,[e,f,g]]] = lists:usort(Term),
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: collect_fixed_apply(0, _) ->
  111:     [];
  112: collect_fixed_apply(N, Mod) ->
  113:     %% The next line calls the error handle function, which is
  114:     %% ?MODULE:undefined_function/3 (it simply returns the list
  115:     %% of args).
  116:     C = Mod:x({a,id(2)}, b, c, d, [e,f,id(g)]),
  117: 
  118:     %% The variable C will be saved onto the stack frame; if C
  119:     %% points into a heap fragment the garbage collector will reach
  120:     %% it and the emulator will crash sooner or later (sooner if
  121:     %% the emulator is debug-compiled).
  122:     Res = collect_fixed_apply(N-1, Mod),
  123:     [C|Res].
  124: 
  125: undefined_function(_Mod, _Name, Args) ->
  126:     Args.
  127: 
  128: error_handler_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  129:     process_flag(error_handler, ?MODULE),
  130: 
  131:     %% fun(A, B, C) -> {A,B,C,X} end in module foobarblurf.
  132:     B = <<131,112,0,0,0,84,3,109,96,69,208,5,175,207,75,36,93,112,218,232,222,22,251,0,
  133:           0,0,0,0,0,0,1,100,0,11,102,111,111,98,97,114,98,108,117,114,102,97,0,98,5,
  134:           244,197,144,103,100,0,13,110,111,110,111,100,101,64,110,111,104,111,115,116,
  135:           0,0,0,46,0,0,0,0,0,104,3,97,1,97,2,97,3>>,
  136:     Fun = binary_to_term(B),
  137:     Term = collect_fun(1024, Fun),
  138:     Term = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)),
  139:     1024 = length(Term),
  140:     [[{foo,bar},{99,1.0},[e,f,g]]] = lists:usort(Term),
  141:     {env,[{1,2,3}]} = erlang:fun_info(Fun, env),
  142:     ok.
  143: 
  144: collect_fun(0, _) ->
  145:     [];
  146: collect_fun(N, Fun) ->
  147:     %% The next line calls the error handle function, which is
  148:     %% ?MODULE:undefined_lambda/3 (it simply returns the list
  149:     %% of args).
  150:     C = Fun({foo,id(bar)}, {99,id(1.0)}, [e,f,id(g)]),
  151: 
  152:     %% The variable C will be saved onto the stack frame; if C
  153:     %% points into a heap fragment the garbage collector will reach
  154:     %% it and the emulator will crash sooner or later (sooner if
  155:     %% the emulator is debug-compiled).
  156:     Res = collect_fun(N-1, Fun),
  157:     [C|Res].
  158: 
  159: undefined_lambda(foobarblurf, Fun, Args) when is_function(Fun) ->
  160:     Args.
  161: 
  162: debug_breakpoint(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  163:     process_flag(error_handler, ?MODULE),
  164:     erts_debug:breakpoint({?MODULE,foobar,5}, true),
  165:     Term = break_collect(1024),
  166:     Term = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)),
  167:     1024 = length(Term),
  168:     [[a,b,c,{d,e},[f,g,h]]] = lists:usort(Term),
  169:     erts_debug:breakpoint({?MODULE,foobar,5}, false),
  170:     ok.
  171: 
  172: break_collect(0) ->
  173:     [];
  174: break_collect(N) ->
  175:     C = foobar(a, b, c, {id(d),e}, [f,g,id(h)]),
  176:     Res = break_collect(N-1),
  177:     [C|Res].
  178: 
  179: breakpoint(?MODULE, foobar, Args) ->
  180:     Args.
  181: 
  182: foobar(_, _, _, _, _) ->
  183:     exit(dont_execute_me).
  184: 
  185: id(I) -> I.
